the mechanic is a good idea, and i actually like its implementation.

Posted By: Mode (1/3/2009 5:41:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A great 2-drop (if not the greatest), even if it was a total mistake. It will be used in all formats it is legal in until the end of Magic. Tarmogoyf fills many roles: A quick aggro beater, a protected control finisher, or a wall... for other Tarmogoyfs.

Posted By: bark_at_the_moonn (11/13/2008 6:32:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'd like to say he's overrated since he represents all that I hate about competitive magic (playing monoblack aggro? +4 [Bayou](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bayou), +4 goyf, or go home kid!) but Tarmogoyf is brutally powerful. He's not always an auto-include imo, as he's \*just\* going to be a 2/3 in an average deck. For most decks though, particularly in the grave abuse of extended, he's a 3/4 or 4/5 and is a necessary weapon. Also, he goes together with the 2nd best 2-drop of all time ([Wild Mongrel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Mongrel))like Peanut Butter and Jelly :)
posts.html:
I'd like to say he's overrated since he represents all that I hate about competitive magic (playing monoblack aggro? +4 Bayou, +4 goyf, or go home kid!) but Tarmogoyf is brutally powerful. He's not always an auto-include imo, as he's *just* going to be a 2/3 in an average deck. For most decks though, particularly in the grave abuse of extended, he's a 3/4 or 4/5 and is a necessary weapon. Also, he goes together with the 2nd best 2-drop of all time (Wild Mongrel)like Peanut Butter and Jelly :)

Posted By: GicmaTheGatherer (9/22/2009 9:59:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: A very efficient creature. Two mana for what amounts to a 3/4, 4/5 or even a 5/6 is.. crazy, to say the least. That, and the cool "future" card frame, the monster itself looking awesome, and the fact that we will probably never see this fellow reprinted combine to make this a very nice piece of cardboard. Best Grizzly Bear ever in my opinion, and in legacy, a typical choice for a finisher for a wide range of decks, and just about larger than all of the other options, too.
posts.html:

Posted By: UNBAN_SHAHRAZAD (8/17/2009 7:15:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've never understood just what was so great about this card. So, situationally, you could have an 8/9 for 1G. Yes, it's very, very good. It's still very much vulnerable to...  
  
[Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror)  
[Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang)  
[Remove Soul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Remove Soul)  
[Deathmark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathmark)  
[Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell)  
[Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God)  
[Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeance) or whatever the new black reprint of it is.  
  
In other words, it's good against anything that isn't blue or black, since those two really don't give a crap how big your creatures are. If it had Shroud, it would be gawd and would have to be illegal. As it is... It's a very good card that sees way too much use in my opinion.
posts.html:
